visual.data
Class Node

java.lang.Object
  visual.data.Node

public class Node
extends java.lang.Object

A Node is an element in the heirarchical file structure that represents either a file or directory. Each node stores information about the file it represents, as well as any child nodes (sub-files/folders) that it possesses.

Author:
Peter Pretorius

Field Detail

children

private Node[] children
Each node points to child nodes, resulting in top-down access. The root node will hence be the partition identifier

name

private java.lang.String name
The name of this node. This is the relative path of the file associated with this node

path

private java.lang.String path
The absolute path of this node. Paths are constructed as nodes are created, with each node inheriting the cumulative path of its parent nodes

size

private long size
The size of the file associated with this node. This is a local size i.e. for directories this value will reportedly be zero. Once the entire tree has been constructed, the size of directory nodes will be recalculated
